source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: When small-width blocks are used to stress the rings, they deform elastically with a linear stress distribution across the clad wall so there is no residual hoop strain in the rings on removing them from the blocks.

source_id: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: when the block size is increased sufficiently that the yield point is exceeded at the ring surfaces, the resultant plastic deformation redistributes the stress profile through the clad wall nonuniformly. Therefore, on removal from the block, a residual stress $\sigma _ { \mathsf { R } }$ will exist at the inside surface.

evidence_span: In a light-water reactor (LWR) fuel rod, mechanical and chemical interactions between the fuel pellet and the Zircaloy cladding tube can result in cladding failures.
